class obstacle_detection.ObstacleTracker(hsv_min, hsv_max, robot_size_in_pixels)

Bases: object

Obstacle tracker class

convert_center_to_pixels(image, shortest_path)

Convert every middle point of the path from indexes to pixels

Parameters

  • image (ndarray) – Input image

  • shortest_path (list) – Shortest path indexes

Returns

Shortest path pixels

Return type

list

does_image_contain_obstacles(image)

Check if image contain obstacles, by obstacle we describe every pixel with a specific color, in this case is RED

Parameters

image (ndarray) – Input image

Returns

True if image contains obstacle otherwise False

Return type

bool

draw_map(image, obstacles_map, shortest_path=None, start_index=None, goal_index=None, line=1, imshow=False)

Draw the map with obstacles and shortest path

Parameters

  • image (ndarray) – Input image

  • obstacles_map (list) – Obstacles map

  • shortest_path (list, optional) – Shortest path, defaults to None

  • start_index (tuple, optional) – Start index, defaults to None

  • goal_index (tuple, optional) – Goal index, defaults to None

generate_map(image, cur_pos_center, goal_pos_center)

Getting the current and target position pixels, generate a map of obstacles and return the map and the corresponding indexes of the current and target points.

Parameters

  • image (ndarray) – Input image

  • cur_pos_center (tuple) – Current position center pixels

  • goal_pos_center (tuple) – Target position center pixels

Return obstacles_map

Obstacles map

Rtype obstacles_map

list

Return cur_pos_center_indexes

Current position center indexes

Rtype cur_pos_center_indexes

tuple

Return goal_pos_center_indexes

Target position center indexes

Rtype goal_pos_center_indexes
